parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical System Failure (Balmar Alternator and Regulator Issues)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause fires, electrical shocks, and loss of critical systems, posing a significant risk to the safety of the occupants and other road users.
symptoms: Smoke or flames from under the hood
and failure of the blind spot monitoring system.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Poor Workmanship and Failure to Follow Recall Procedures
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure to follow recall procedures and poor workmanship can lead to incomplete or incorrect repairs, posing a risk to the safety of the occupants and other road users.
symptoms: failure to inspect or implement recall procedures
and lack of interest from manufacturers.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the blind spot monitoring system can cause accidents or near-misses, posing a risk to the safety of the occupants and other road users.
symptoms: Unreliable or faulty blind spot monitoring system
and failure to detect vehicles in the blind spot.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the water drainage system can cause water accumulation, leading to electrical system failures, fires, and damage to the vehicle.
The failure of the blind spot monitoring system can increase the risk of accidents, as drivers may not be aware of vehicles in their blind spots, leading to potential collisions or near-misses.
symptoms: causing the driver to be unaware of vehicles in their blind spots. In some cases
the system may illuminate the wrong warning light
leading to confusion and potential accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire belt separation can lead to a blowout, causing loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potentially life-threatening situations, especially at high speeds.
